newsitem.title: USA: Talbots adds $40 mln to buyback budget.
newsitem.headline: Talbots adds $40 mln to buyback budget.

text.p: Talbots Inc said Friday its board extended the company's stock buyback program, adding $40 million to its share repurchase authorization.
The move follows the repurchase of $40 million in shares in a buyback completed earlier this month, Talbots said.

The women's apparel retailer said it will purchase a proportionate number of shares from Jusco (U.S.A.) Inc to maintain the same percentage of ownership between Jusco and public shareholders. Jusco (U.S.A.), a unit of Japanese retail conglomerate Jusco Co Ltd, owns 63.4 percent of Talbots, Talbots said.
Since November 1995, when Talbots first began its first buy-back program, it has repurchased about two-and-a-half million shares at a cost of more than $73 million, it said.
Talbots said it has about 32.7 million shares outstanding.
